data.title: First visit to a Cafe in the US
data.text:
I went to Oakland to attend its famous First Friday festival, and my friend from Oakland told me to meet up at this Cafe.
First thing you need to know is that this Cafe offers counter service, which means that they won't take your order while you're sitting at a table. You have to go to the counter and order. Also, you have to bus your on table, i.e. You should take your dishes back to the counter after you're done. It is not the most affordable coffee you can get in Oakland, but it is really good coffee. I had a cappuccino and my friend had a vanilla latte, and we were both impressed by the taste.

data.title: Great Vegan and Vegetarian Selection of Sandwiches, Salads
data.text: We stopped in for a quick sandwich and were delighted by the vegan and vegetarian selections. The sandwiches were scrumptious and the baked goods equally delicious. Nice atmosphere and convenient location.

data.title: Good place to relax
data.text: This place is great. They serve coffee and pastries, but also beer and sandwiches so i can meet friends for beer and food or coffee and pastries. Plus, it's right by BART and easy to get to so I never have to worry about parking. They have live music here but I don't usually stay for it because it gets loud in there and so far none of the bands have been to my taste. Good place to relax or study.

data.title: fun cafe with live music in the evenings
data.text:
Great place for a cup of coffee, getting some work done, and people watching. They don't serve a ton of food - bagels, pastries, etc in the morning - but the coffee is good and it's nice to be served in real cups instead of disposable ones. 

You can also grab a beer and listen to live music in the evenings on some days.

data.title: good tea and wine!
data.text: great tea, great wine - came here with friends during the day. my friend got a caprese sandwich that looked really good, and i definitely want to try their food next time i go. a really cute cafe in a nice part of oakland!
